alert.note: Alert for Coshocton; Muskingum (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pittsburgh (Western Pennsylvania and East Central Ohio)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 27 at 5:06PM EST by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT COSHOCTON AND MUSKINGUM COUNTIES THROUGH 545 PM EST... At 505 PM EST, Doppler radar was tracking a cluster of strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Granville South to Buckeye Lake to near Somerset to near Logan. Movement was northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Zanesville, Coshocton, New Concord, South Zanesville, North Zanesville, Dresden, Frazeysburg, Philo, Warsaw, Pleasant Grove, Conesville, and Gratiot. This includes Interstate 70 in Ohio near mile marker 143, and between mile markers 145 and 170. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 700 PM EST for east central Ohio.
